Articles.Content:
I've had this A320 on the back burner, and when someone asked that I release it I decided that it's time had come.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/7iYir)

This flies best with NEAR or FAR.

It is possible to land in FAR/NEAR but it's very hard in stock.

It is unusually acrobatic in FAR/NEAR but in Stock it flies like a pig.

If you are using FAR you will have to reset the flaps/spoilers.(Everything should be a flap but the tail, rudder and wing tip control surfaces. The ones mounted on top of the wing should be spoilers.)

Enjoy!

[Download](http://kerbalx.com/Mad_Rocket_Scientist/A320)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-06T21:09:06Z" title="07/06/2015 09:09  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 6, 2015</time> by Mad Rocket Scientist**

Nice work! 

Although I suggest that you tweak the tail and winglets a bit, to look like the "arrow" winglets the A320 series uses.

Sort of like this:

![3418234715_17791d5faf.jpg](https://c2.staticflickr.com/4/3637/3418234715_17791d5faf.jpg)

Nice anyways.

> 
> Nice work! 
> Although I suggest that you tweak the tail and winglets a bit, to look like the "arrow" winglets the A320 series uses.
> 
> Sort of like this:
> 
> [https://c2.staticflickr.com/4/3637/3418234715_17791d5faf.jpg](https://c2.staticflickr.com/4/3637/3418234715_17791d5faf.jpg)
> 
> Nice anyways.

Airbus is retrofiting the old wingtip fences into sharklets so it's not all to inaccurate though ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

[http://www.airbus.com/newsevents/news-events-single/detail/the-sharklets-success-story-continues-with-airbus-retrofit-offer-for-a319-and-a320-jetliners/](http://www.airbus.com/newsevents/news-events-single/detail/the-sharklets-success-story-continues-with-airbus-retrofit-offer-for-a319-and-a320-jetliners/)

![sharklet_a320.jpg](https://theflyingengineer.files.wordpress.com/2013/01/sharklet_a320.jpg)

Wow, really nice. It crashes a lot, too? Then it's even more realistic! ^^

(Seriously though. That thing is like the 787 of Airbus, but worse.)

EDIT: Post 700

Thanks!

I think the references I using had the sharklets instead of the arrow winglets.
